Great drill that really accomplishes any: I've been able to easily screw in 3" construction screws into dry fir.
Great for flooring applications and really nice slow speed to make sure you're starting steady.
The two batteries that come with this kit are great.
I've been able to go a full day without swapping.
The only time I need to swap more often is if I'm using a 1" wood drill bit going through very dry fir beams/joists.
I've been able to use an 18" long 1" wood drill bit without so much as a slowdown.
Very impressive for a drill this size.
It's my general use drill that I use for pretty much anything.
There is a reason why I only buy dewalt.
They practically gave this drill set away.
A must have for any household.
great for standard projects.
Bump up to the impact models if your gonna build a barn.
I purchased this item for only $99 at HD.
This unit includes 2 Ni-cad batteries.
Why get these instead of the newer Lithium-ion?
Research on the web shows that Lithium-ion batteries have a shelf life between 2-3 years.
So, unlike Ni-cads, EVEN IF YOU DON'T USE THEM, they will degrade and need replacing in a couple of years.
How long have they been sitting on the shelf before you buy them is anyone's guess but that is part of the battery's shelf life.
Then when you do go buy new ones they cost as much as the kit did to begin with.
Perhaps if you are a professional that uses the drill all day, day after day you will be ready for a new kit every couple of years.
But for the average Joe who might not use the drill for 3-4 months, you are losing battery life regardless.
Do your wallet a favor and stick with Ni-cads until the technology improves.
This is an excellent drill with plenty of power.
Also, Ni-cads continue to work in cold weather unlike Lithium-ions that won't.
Just my 2c.
It is impossible to beat the deal on this cordless drill, but be aware that this is Dewalt's entry level drill.
It comes with their smaller batteries (1700mAh) compared to the larger capacity XRP batteries (2400mAh).
So when people say that replacement batteries are $60 each they are referring to the larger XRP batteries.
The batteries that this drill comes with are not even sold separately, or if they are not at any stores that I have seen.
It also has a limited speed compared to their larger and heavier XRP drill which also has the hammerdrill capability for drilling into masonry and hard material.
It has treated me well for household jobs and carpentry jobs around the house, but it has its limits.
Example:  I wanted to get rid of a stump in the yard and the directions for the "stump out" required drilling 10" deep by 1/2" wide holes.
The drill could not handle it.
The motor started smoking.
To be fair I knew this was asking a lot.
The reason I still give it 5 starts is that it finished the job with a lot of coaxing and still works despite melting something internally.
Solid drill but if you want to do some heavy drilling then upgrade to the XRP model.
This is the drill I was looking for so long.
I had gone t HD to buy a dewalt drill and they were too expensive.
Now I found this drill for $120.00 at Amazon, I already put it to use.
I built a shelf 9'x7' 4 levels made out of wood.
Solid shelf.
One battery lasted almost for the entire job.
But this drill comes with two; so while you use one, have the other one charging.
This replaces my 14.4V Dewalt which after 8 yrs was still running strong except for the two factory Ni-Cad batteries which finally would not hold a charge any longer.
The cheapest after-market 14.4 batteries ran $40 apiece and the Dewalts were about $60 apiece so getting a more powerful new 18V drill with two factory batteries at $99 was a no-brainer.
These new 18V batteries should last 8 yrs as well and by then I expect Ni-Cads will be pretty much obsolete and the litium ion drills will have come down in price when time comes for replacement.
I always look for a great price,warranty and fast free shipping from Amazon.com when compared to other sellers on amazon which sometimes can be a bit of a hassle on returns.
12/18/2011 Great little driver.
Came with the smaller batteries 2ea (not XRP) but totally okay for non-commercial use.
Unit is not near as heavy as the other drivers or it's larger Dewalt cousins so that is an excellent plus for repetitive use.
Really good value....  Would give 5 stars if the larger batteries were included but considering the cost and quality one really can't complain.
This is an "old school" drill that in fact has been discontinued by Dewalt.
It has a power rating of 380 which is somewhat less than the average drill (480).
Battery size is 1.7AH while most Dewalt drills now have at least 2.4AH.
This drill does not have a LED work light which is standard on all drills made in the past few years.
Weight is about average at 5.2 Lbs.
with battery.
All-in-all for 89 bucks this is still a good deal especially for the home owner market.
If you think about it, the batteries alone are worth $89...so in a sense, you're getting the drill, charger and case for free.
It's a decent drill but the battery life on both only lasted 2 years.
Dewalt battery has a very short life span!
This is just a way for dewalt to charge you another $$$$ for newer ones.
I have many dewalt tools but this will be the first one I switch!
I received this drill through Amazon as a wedding gift in August, 2012.
The chuck broke (one of the vises in the chuck seized up) in October, 2013.
When I dropped it off for repair at an authorized service center they told me DeWalt automatically considers the chuck a wear item and I had to pay for its repair.
So I got stuck with a $55 repair bill on a $99 drill after 14 months of light use.
This failure to cover the chuck isn't mentioned anywhere in the manual or the item description.
Since DeWalt doesn't honor their warranty, I won't be buying any more DeWalt, Black & Decker, or Porter Cable tools (all the same company).
I am saddened by this since I've bought almost all DeWalt tools and have never had a problem with any others.
I have many more tools to purchase and will have to go with a different brand.
What is Included: One , two 18-volt NiCAD batteries, one one-hour charger, and a hard plastic carrying case (a lot better then the cloth bag setup some products come with).
Uses: *Drills 3in drywall screws without issue.
*Enough power to use on wood, plastic or metal with the appropriate drill bit.
*Single charged battery can be used to drill over 200 1-5/8 sheetrock screws without any effort and still have enough battery charge to continue using the drill.
Pros: *Long lasting charge and quick charging batteries x2.
Batteries will typically last for 2 to 3 years under normal use.
*NiCAD batteries don't have a memory effect so they can be charged anytime.
*18v so enough power for just about all your needs.
*Sturdy construction, can be dropped without worries.
*Great price for a drill that includes two batteries at a cost of $99.
*Great torque for just about any job you throw at it.
*Batteries are swappable between other Dewalt power tools.
Cons: *No quick connect feature.
*It is a little heavy but then it is a 18v drill.
NOTE: This is a drill only and doesn't include drill bits.
Top quality by DeWalt!
This drill kit does not disappoint!
Bought for my husband to use, but I use it as often or more often.
We love that the batteries can also be used with the DeWalt impact driver he recently purchased and BOTH DeWalt products can be used with newer DeWalt battery packs.
Heavy duty.
I chose this because it still had NiCad batteries.
Had a drill with Lithium Ion.
Batteries lasted a little over a year, I used it maybe 5 times.
Did some research, seems like Lithium are great but have a short life, whether you use them or not.
NiCad aren't as good, but if you use them occasionally, they last longer than Lithium.
Recieved this drill and was surprised by the lack of quality.
The speed switch on top did not engage properly.
I returned for a refund.
I ended up going with Milwaukee and found the quality was lacking with them too.
But stuck with them because their drill also had a hammer drill function.
in picture on amazon it showed a hard case but when i got it it has a soft case not what i was looking for.
I ordered the Dewalt 18 volt drill/driver kit to drive screws to repair a deck and to do drive screws and drill holes in other areas of my house and yard.

The screw driver was quite powerfull driving screws into deckking and I had to set the torque controls on the chuck lower to keep from driving the screw heads on 3 inch screws 1/4-1/2 inch below the wood surface.
After driving screws all afternoon, I was quite happy with the product.
A few weeks later I had to drill holes through sheet metal, and noticed the drill bit wobbling badly, making it difficult to start the hole.
After removing and reinserting the drill bit a few times, I realized that the problem was a bent shaft to the chuck.
I didnt notice it using the short phillips head driver attachment, but it definitely made a difference in performance with a longer drill bit.
I really liked the drill/driver and wanted a replacement rather than a return/refund.
I was past the 30 day no questions return period anyway, but to their ccredit, Amazon still allowed me an exchange.
I recieved the replacemtn 2 days later and the new drill appears to function correctly and has a straight chuck shaft.
This tool is powerful, has a short body to allow access to smaller spaces, and seems to have a long battery life (I havent completely dishcarge a battery yet).
I'm used to the XRP batteries and these aren't close to that.
But for the price it should function well.
Made building some farm-like buildings so much easier.
Easy enough to exchange bits.
Used it to put in exterior wood screws, 2 x 4s , 4 x 4s, plywood.
Our animals are happier for it.
Then I used it on a simple assemble-yourself set of shelves, as screwdriver.
Got what I expected and I expected high quality.
Great to finally have a quality drill and driver kit.
This comes with an extra battery, but as of yet I have not used it since the initial battery holds its charge so well.
The price was fantastic as well, couldn't be beat.
Highly recommend this product.
Very useful drill for small projects.
Plenty of power and you can't beat Dewalt products.
Wish it had two slots for drill bits.
The chuck will not hold drills tight enough to drill through steel.
But the batteries holds charges for a long time when not in use.
I love DeWalt tools they seem to be always over the top on design, versatility and ease of use.
I had bought this drill with batteries and charger several months back and really had not a chance to use until yesterday.

I pulled out drill and charger and grabbed a battery to charge, put in charger and left for about 4 hours, came back still no charge, swapped batteries out and had the other battery charged within 45 minutes.
I went and finished my project, came back to charge the other battery, still dead the next day and even into late evening.
I would have given a 5 star but I want what I pay for.
Will probably never buy tools online again.
works great but i thought it would have a few more options on it like my 14v XRP.
Plus it only has 2 speeds .
DeWALT is one of the premier "contractor grade" names in power tools.
Having used a residential grade drill for the past 7 or so years, please allow me to say that this tool was a quantum leap forward.
Some things to consider: 1.
You get TWO batteries INCLUDED.
This means that once you drain one you can flip to the other batter and keep drilling.
You won't lose valuable time on the job waiting for your battery to recharge.
If you are conscientious then you will never be without drilling power.
The keyless chuck is VERY heavy duty and maintains a very tight grip on the drill bit.
This means that you won't bury your bit in the wood only to have the chuck let go and leave your bit behind.
You can tighten up the chuck again and back it out slowly if it ever happens to you with another drill but who has time for that?
The drill's housing is heavy duty and will withstand countless drops and keep on ticking.
As the site's picture suggests, it comes with a heavy duty carry case which will protect your drill and batteries even further.
Drilling power and speed is extraordinary.
You will effortlessly drive your drill bit in and out with little to no resistance from the wood or whatever you are drilling.
I bought this on sale for $100 but it would still be a bargain at the list price of $150.
This drill is an extraordinary find and I would recommend it to a friend.
chuck wobble, will be sending it back.
oddly, not eligible for replacement (shows out of stock) until you search amazon to buy and then it shows availible???????
will be trying Bosch CLPK232-181 18-Volt Lithium-Ion 2-Tool Combo Kit instead.
After reading the other reviews (after I found the problem) I think I am off Dewalt products
By the time one battery dies, the other is charged up.
I'm not able to take as many "breaks" from working now!
I bought this tool because I have owned drill drivers made by DeWalt before and had very good service from them.
Battery life is also acceptable.
Love this 18v drill/driver kit for its ease of use, power and more.
The keyless lock is great and fast, reducing a step you'd otherwise have to take changing out bits and the driver.
The locking sprocket mechanism is great because it ensures the drill stops exactly when you want it to -- not overdriving or drilling.
Helps accuracy.
It's all lightweight enough to make it easy to use without being weighty on the arm.
Battery recharges in an hour, as promised, and runs for a long, long time.
I was surprised to receive a drill that looked more like it was reconditioned than new.
The screws had dirt on them and there were tape marks on the drill itself and on the battery.
I looked back at the description and did not see that it would be reconditioned.
This is the first thing that I have received from Amazon that was not up to the high standards I am use to from them.
I've owned this drill for over a year and use it every day at work.
I use it to drill through, concrete, brick, and stainless steel.
It really gets punished and so far has survived 100 plane rides, numerous rain storms (I drill through brick from the outside), and a couple of 10 ft drops to concrete.
Other than swapping between the 2 batteries frequently, I cant complain.
I have a 15 year old Dewalt 18 volt drill and it is better quality than my new one.
This new one will do the job but I fell it wont hold up to as much abuse.

DEWALT DC970K-2 18-Volt Drill/Driver Kit  works as stated and the best thing was it came with an extra battery and nice carry case.

this drill has a lot of power and the batteries last.

Update:  Bought a 80 dollar Ryobi at Home Depot that is built just as well with better chuck performance.
Since these 50-200 dollars drills all seem to be disposable these days I think the Ryobi is a better option for home owners even if the lithium batteries die after a year.
As others have stated and I did not believe until I received my copy, this drill is a lower quality drill.
Dewalt is now producing a product line in the lower quality segment.
This is not to say they don't have high-end tools, but this is not one.
I am replacing a 14.4 volt dewalt I bought in a kit about six years ago for slightly more money considering it was two tools.
This new drill is not comparable.
The chuck on this new drill is very low quality and is difficult to install bits straight or even get it to close down on your Phillips driver without jamming.
You get what you pay for and frankly I was not sure what a good 18v ni-cad drill cost these days with the Lithium drills out.
I had a bad/expensive experience with Lithum batteries (they die if you don't use them regularly) so I was looking for a solid mid-range ni-cad drill.
This is not mid range.
I'm going to go up the dewalt food chain a bit further.
Unless you are on a hard-core budget do yourself a favor and get a little more expensive model that has a name-brand or quality chuck.
My 14.4 volt drill (the old one) had a Jacob's chuck and it served me well for a long time.
I have owned two Dewalts in the last 15 years and this is my second.
I have found this model to out perform Craftsman or Ryobi dollar for dollar.
Very pleased with the performance and quality and cant beat the price.
Works great but the battery doesn't hold a decent charge under continuous use.
You might be better off saving a little bit more to get a lithium powered drill.
We already have three of these in our plant.
Hold up well to my ham handed maintenance guys.
Battery life has been very good and the quick charger is, well, quick.
Nice thing I like about the drill is you can get parts for them without much grief.
Excellent value at $99 bucks vs the box stores.
In an industrial setting, they are almost indestructible.
Balance and weight is pretty decent and shouldn't give you carpal tunnel after a days use.
Dewalt makes both inexpensive (read cheap) and really good (read expensive) and this drill is a decent compromise.
I don't feel near as bad when one of my guys runs over a $99 drill vs the $200+ one with a forklift.
In a home owner setting, it most likely will die because you left on the patio table in the rain or your bro-in-law borrowed it and ran it over with his car.
Great drill for household chores.received in a timely manner.my only concern,I was under the impression it would come with a hardcase.it only came with a nylon/canvas bag.
dewalt drill to me is one of the best brands this drill makes my job easy and comfortable to work

I am a do it your-self'er, and one needs decent tools to "do it yourself"...
This drill was the one I wanted 8 years ago when I bought a B&D.

The B&D finally burnt up and gave me the chance to buy the one I wanted all along...The Dewalt has two speeds.The speed for drilling is something I've never had before.Drilled thru 2x10's like an electric drill would.
The brute force is unbelievable compared to my old drills.even the looks are Quality all the way...I have not been as happy with a purchase in a long time!!
!Add that to the fact I only paid $99.00 and shipping... A GREAT deal...

I had a palm sander, which was a brand other than Dewalt.
It was better than hand sanding, but once I upgraded to a Dewalt, I was so impressed, I decided to upgrade all my power tools.
This was a great price on a great drill.
I carry it around the house, looking for things to fix.
I have had one of these before - when a single battery costs over $50 and this drill comes with 2 its like getting a drill for free.
You will not get a better deal for the price.
For the 99 bucks I paid for this, it's hard to find something to complain about.
With a spare battery, a rugged carrying case, and Dewalt quality, it was a great price for a tool I keep around the house for all kinds of jobs.
We had a previous Dewalt Kit which lasted us many years and made many repair jobs considerably easier.
We got the drill bit and screwdriving sets and everything fits into the new Kit.
I have had my DeWalt 18v cordless drill for quite some time now, enough time to have a collection of 4 batteries for it, along with numerous accessories.
I am not using my drill in a career, but it's my go to power tool for the garage / home improvement type of guy I am.

With a full battery charge, the drill has astounding power and I have used it for numerous projects from hanging pictures, mounting TV's, all the way to bolting down equipment to concrete (drilling holes into the concrete).
It truly is amazing the power it has.
The best part, the drill has lasted through the "abuse and torture" I have put it through and it keeps on going.
Should this drill ever go out, or if I find myself needing a more heavy duty drill, I will definitely buy another DeWalt.
My Husband loves getting his hands dirty.
This is a heavy duty drill, and perfect for large and small projects around the house.
It's really durable, and I'm happy because little things get done a lot faster.
I have owned this cordless drill for over a year and it is great.
It does everything I expected and more.
Holds a charge for quite a long period of time.
I bought this as a Christmas present for myself (my wife and I usually do this every year).
The batteries on my old Ryobi drill were drained and this was only $20 more than replacing the batteries.
First of all, for a guy this drill is light.
Second, this drill is powerful.
I haven't run into anything yet that this drill couldn't handle although I have yet to try and drill into concrete or something like that.
Third and most important some reviewers have said that the chuck was coming loose on them.
You can loosen and tighten this chuck with one hand.
To properly tighten it you have to tighten it until you hear it click, then go one or two more clicks.
All in all I am VERY satisfied with this drill, even more because of the price.
I bought this drill to replace a 12V drill whose batteries would no longer hold a charge.
This entire kit was less money than purchasing just new batteries for the old drill.
I can not believe the difference in torque this drill has over my old drill.
I also like the fact that this drill has a  1/2 inch chuck enabling more flexability in drill sizes.
Great drill for the price, but the small batteries don't last as long as the older big ones did.
I would give five stars if the batteries lasted longer.
This is a powerful drill even though the size is compact.
Having two batteries is a plus.
It is easy to mount drill bits.
The price is reasonable for a well-known brand name.
Prior to buying this drill, I owned another cordless drill from a no name brand company.
Battery on the drill would discharge fast, drill had a lot of power when fully charge but within 20-30 minutes of use, it would getting slower.
This drill puts any drill I have ever used to shame.
I charged the battery once and I have used it several times over the last month and it's still going strong.
There are times when I have to lower down the torque just so that it doesn't end up damaging the screw.
Overall, a really great buy.
This is professional grade drill that won't disappoint you.

best drill I've bought to date.
long lasting batteries is just what i needed.

I've never owned a power drill until I recently moved into a new house recently.
I had an electrician come over to install a few outlets and noticed she was using a power drill to screw and unscrew things.
I talked to her about the drill and she suggested anything made by DeWalt.
I went online and saw the different options.
The electrician said if I was planning on doing general house work I could go with a 12 volt drill.
I ended up deciding on the 18 volt due to price and reviews.
I don't know what the 12 volt is like, but I love this drill and the fact that it came with 2 batter packs AND attached is a bit that gives you both heads of a screwdriver.
I didn't know this when I bought the drill so I went out and bought other bits, but I don't think that's necessary when the basics already come with this.
Would highly suggest to anyone.
I am Very pleased with this DeWalt 18 volt drill.
It would be good if one could change the voltage just by using a switch on the charger from 110 to 240 volts instead of having to buy a reducing transformer from 240 volts down to 110 volts.
I think that those from outside the USA should be told that only 110 volt outlet can be used and other countries with differant outlets will need a reducing transformer.
However it was still a lot cheaper having to spend the extra money buying a 240v down to 110v transformer than buying a DeWalt 18 volt battery drill from Australia.
Now I can buy other appliances from the USA and use the drop down transformer that I now have.
I am waiting for DeWalt to bring out more attachments that I can use by using the same batteries.
I've always wanted a Dewalt drill and now that I have one I'm glad I bought it.
I've owned MANY cordless drills from Craftsman to Black and Decker and most in between.
The secret is in the battery.
This drill comes with two.
I've fallen for the cheapo Harbor Freight $20 drills but they last about a year.
The drill doesn't die but the battery does.
It simply doesn't hold a charge.
I can shelf my Dewalt for 6 months and it holds a charge like new.
Not that you'd want to but the battery quality makes ANY cordless tool.
Well balanced and just feels right.
I love my Dewalt, I have this setup and it has not let me down yet.
Also being a woman I cannot use anything that is too heavy, it is solid but not over the top as far as weight.

I find that the charger does the trick very quickly I find that if I am using the drill I make sure the other charger is hooked up so I never have to wait, but on the occasion that I had to, which has happened, it only took 1/2 hour to 1 hour to fully charge.
It is really very strong and will crack any screw that may be stuck, although it may take some time to do it.
I have made some projects aht take a long time and this unit is a power house and the charge lasts a long time.
top quality as far as i am concerned.
i have older DeWalt items that have stood the test of time,one of the major factorss in purchaching this item.Worth the MONEY!!
I was really surprised how powerful this drill is.
It's a great deal for a do-it-yourselfer.
I also like how the chuck locks in when tightening it up around a bit.
After a week, it seems well made.
Even though I already own a drill, the Hitachi, I saw this at Home Depot for $99 and thought, wow, for that price, yeah I'm going to buy it!
It comes with a molded plastic case, TWO batteries,(which cost around $60 A PIECE!
Bonus!
) a charger, and a standard screwdriver bit.
If you're already familiar with DeWalt tools, you know that they are heavy duty, this one being no different.
I guess they're selling them for 99 bucks because DeWalt is coming out with a new 20-Volt drill, so I would buy one of these while you can, especially for this great price!
If you're not familiar with DeWalt drills, they are pretty much the standard drill of choice in the industrial enviroment, capable of doing pretty much anything you need a heavy duty drill to do.
This particular drill is perfectly capable.
It doesn't have the hammer drill setting like some other DeWalt's.
The clutch on it is VERY precise.
The batteries DO last a very long time, and it's nice to have the two provided.
The drill IS pretty heavy, but well balanced.
This drill really is worth buying for the $99 bucks they have them now at Lowes or Home Depot.
I would say I would pay up to $135 for this drill.
Great purchase!
Also would recommend buying if you only need the two batteries.
I bought this in December and have been using it a lot in a basement remodeling project.
It has fantastic torque and good battery life.
I've been amazed at how many 3/4" holes I can bore through studs and joists before replacing the battery.
This replaced an older Dewalt 9.8V drill, which gave many years of excellent service till the batteries started losing capacity.
Besides the extra power, the improvement I like most in this drill is the one-handed ratcheting keyless chuck.
This makes it much easier to tighten the chuck down hard on a bit.
My husband had been looking for a new drill/driver, and when I saw it on Amazon for the great price, it made his Christmas.
I don't usually buy my hubby tools, but this was just what he wanted.
I will not buy any other type cordless drills -only DeWalts.
I've had several other brands and the batteries will not hold or take a charge after a few months.
I have an 18 volt De Walt that I've had for years and it is still going strong.
I bought one of these 4 years ago and it lasted fairly well.
Did not realize that I was buying what seems to be 5 yr old stock.
New batteries don't have much more life than the ones that were 5 yr old on a fresh charge.
No improvement to the chuck for locking on to round drill bits.
I Received this drill yesterday.
It looks like it has been  used, also was missing double ended tip.
Like another reviewer, the product I received clearly was not new.

The packaging had obviously been opened before, there were scuff marks on the case under the packaging, there were scuffs on the batteries and drill itself, and the manual and documents were wadded up in the case.
I haven't used the drill yet, so this review doesn't reflect on the product.
However, I purchased directly from Amazon and the product was shipped from Amazon, so this review is relevant to how the product might arrive at a purchaser's door.
All of that said, I don't care about the aesthetics, so I won't return the drill if it works.
Update 4/9/13: I used this drill on my first major project over Easter weekend and I'm happy with it's performance.
I used it to strip paint and rust off the rocker panels on my daily driver so I could perform a little restoration work.
The drill just powered right through everything.

I had to switch batteries early on, but the fresh battery did most of the project and still retained it's power when it was used for another small project a couple of days ago, and made it through most of that project before needing change.
These batteries have reasonably long life compared to my previous drill when being used in severe conditions like this.
You will certainly get longer life when you are just driving screws or drilling holes, I was running the drill full speed and it was receiving strong resistance for extended periods of time.
ALWAYS run your batteries dead before putting them into the charger!
I have NiCad batteries from my old drill that are over 10 years old and still hold a good charge because of this practice!
You can't blame DeWalt for your lack of proper maintenance!
********************* I'm the kind of guy that likes to get the best value for his dollar.
I believe that with this product, I did.
This is just a drill driver, and its a lighter weight, slightly compact model, so don't expect to this to be as applicable in as many projects as pricier full-sized DeWalt models.
It is hands down a wonderful tool for basic household projects.

It still has an adjustable clutch, forward/reverse, keyless chuck, two batteries, and 18 volts of glorious long-lasting power to play with when applied properly, setting screws, drilling holes, or even buffing the car.
The price for this product is nothing short than excellent, especially if you found it on sale for $99 like myself and many others here have.
I went to the local L0wes store to purchase mine, and Amazon would have been my fallback had they ran out.
The batteries themselves cost $99, and since I needed a drill I thought what the heck, early birthday present to myself.
When I cracked open the package and first picked up the drill, I knew this was something I was going to like.
And upon giving it a go with a battery in, I was quite impressed at the difference over my old drill.
This drill feels and operates in my hand more naturally than other drills I've used.
My stepdad does carpentry as a hobby and on the side for friends, and his cordless brand of choice is DeWalt.

I viewed DeWalt as overpriced and used to think it was silly of him to spend so much money when you can get another brand with the same features for less than half the price, but now I realize why he buys DeWalt.
They make a product that is worth the money, and when you get it on sale, you are getting probably one of the best values on the market.
I now consider myself a lifetime DeWalt fan and user.
If anything changes with this product, I will be sure to revisit and update my review.
Right up front, this drill is not as high quality as the Makita it replaced.
But since it cost less money than just the new BATTERIES I needed for the Makita, I didn't expect it to be.
Functionally, it is as good or better than the Makita, but the fit and finish and apparent quality of materials seem to be a bit less.
Not enough to matter for the way that I use the tool, maybe a couple of times a week for a few minutes.

I have observed the slight chuck wobble mentioned in other reviews, but again, for what I use it for, a quarter-inch hole that comes out five or ten thousandths of an inch oversize is of no consequence.
If you are a professional and absolute precision is critical, perhaps a different, more expensive tool would better meet your needs.
tanstaafl.
Awesome product, great price!
this is our third set in the family, so we know how great it really is.
The drill works very well.
It arrived very quickly and has been a work horse since we got it.
I do a lot of work with cordless tools at home and on the job, so I was pleasantly surprised when this item came up for sale at a lower prize (Home Depot used to sell it at $199).

I used it to replace the wood on my patio within days of receiving it and as usual, DeWalt tools perform steadily, get the job done quickly and have enough power to drive the 2 1/2 inch screws through the wood.
I was a little bit disappointed with the amount of battery capacity so.
Even so there are too of them and you can recharge one while using the other, they drain their capacity too fast for a professional job.

The only other issue with the item is that it went on sale at Home Depot for $99.00 only 2 weeks after I purchased mine because DeWalt came out with a 20V cordless tool set and seems to dump the 18V series at lower prizes.
